radiographic_examinations.findings: Lytic lesion involving L5 with destruction of the left pedicle and central portions of the vertebral body.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the lumbar spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: Involvement of the lamina and presence of a very large, hypervascular paraspinal mass extending into and filling the spinal canal.
Indeterminate nodule (3 mm in diameter) in the left upper lobe; otherwise normal.
High uptake between L5 and the first sacral vertebra (S1).
Local recurrence at the tumor bed; lung metastases noted.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The mass had increased in size; lung nodules developed or grew.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mass of L5â€“S1 decreased in size by more than 50%; duodenal metastasis reduced by more than 80%.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Chest CT revealed enlarging lung metastases.

radiographic_examinations.date: Six years after denosumab therapy began
